channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15691] Port HBASE-10205 (ConcurrentModificationException in BucketAllocator) to branch-1
item.description: HBASE-10205 was committed to trunk and 0.98 branches only. To preserve continuity we should commit it to branch-1. The change requires more than nontrivial fixups so I will attach a backport of the change from trunk to current branch-1 here.
item.summary: Port HBASE-10205 (ConcurrentModificationException in BucketAllocator) to branch-1

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment: I'm on bucketcache these times. Easy enough for me to try this to see if any perf implications.
Thanks stack. I poked around a bit and didn't see obvious problems like failed tests or deadlock.

-1 overall

I'm fine with this in branch-1.2, though that code smell does cause me some concern. Also, the BucketAllocator class expressly calls out that it isn't thread safe, so I'm wondering if we don't have a bigger issue.

Additionally, it looks like there are additional places where the member LinkedLists are accessed outside of a synchronized block.
Thanks Sean Busbey Let me take a look since I'm in here and have a rig up for testing this stuff.

I'm not happy with the code but it's weird something went in on master and 0.98 skipping branch-1. We should commit this I think, then have another look at the BC code before we make any release from the result.
Andrew Purtell do you think it should be release blocker for 1.3.0 and 1.2.2? Did you look at the patch yet.

I don't think it's a release blocker. The code doesn't implicate any user facing API and branch-1 is humming along fine without the change apparently. That said I hope we can commit this and then revisit the BC allocator before making any next release.

Andrew Purtell (sorry, in my comment above I meant "did not look at the patch yet", a typo)

Yeah, I think it sounds good.

Took a look at the patch, Is there a reason why we are changing back to linked lists?, I am still seeing LinkedMaps on the master, moving back to linkedLists will probably undo the optimizations done in HBASE-14624.

Is there a reason why we are changing back to linked lists?

The reason is this patch was applied to only master and 0.98, leaving a discontinuity in history and the code base. If someone who knows more about the block cache (stack ?) tells me "it doesn't matter" than fine.

I am still seeing LinkedMaps on the master, moving back to linkedLists will probably undo the optimizations done in HBASE-14624.

This is a backport issue so we could make another version of the patch that includes the changes in HBASE-14624.
Oh ok thanks for clarifying.

Andrew Purtell Looked more at the patch,

  • as Sean Busbey noted, there's two unynchronized methods accessing bucket lists - findAndRemoveCompletelyFreeBucket() and freeBlock(). Since this is a backport, should we also synchronize them? If so, that would then need to go to other branches?
  • seems like the optimization in HBASE-14624 would be easily incorporable into this patch, just changing field types?

Let me know if I can help with reviews here or otherwise...
pinging Andrew Purtell, stack. Let me know if I can help on that, I'm looking forward to get it in 1.3.
Andrew Purtell stack as this one been there for some time in branch-1 and isn't a release blocker, let me move it to 1.4. Will be happy to help to get it in 1.3 or 1.3.1.
This is not a release blocker IMHO. We already have 1.2 out without it.

Andrew Purtell, do you plan to commit it in branch-1 any time soon? I can make another patch if you are busy. We have a customer hitting this issue in 1.x line. (it is strange that HBASE-10205 claims to commit in 0.99, but not in branch-1).
No plans Stephen Yuan Jiang, please proceed if you like

-1 overall

In the V2 patch, I also not added synchronize to findAndRemoveCompletelyFreeBucket() and freeBlock(), as this is backport and the original patch does not do that - if necessary, we can open a new ticket and add synchronize to these two methods in all branches.

Ping - anyone to help do a sanity check on the V2 patch? Andrew Purtell.

Also 1.x release managers (Nick Dimiduk, Sean Busbey, Mikhail Antonov), please let me know whether you want this patch to your owned released 1.x version. (It probably has some perf impact on the path every production system would definitely access; stack mentioned that he would do some perf test in the same code path, since the code already in main and 0.98 branches and I have not heard anything, so I assume that the perf impact is minimal. stack, please let me know if you see noticeable perf impace in bucketcache with this patch)

I'm w/o my cluster for a little while so unable to test. Pardon me.

The added synchronizes seem crass. Any chance of a perf compare, before vs after?

Any chance of a perf compare, before vs after?

+1, with at least some bareboned notes on repro-ing the results if possible please
Moving out of 1.2.3. Commit if done in time for 1.2.3 release.
moved out of patch available pending feedback.
